summary: The document is a memorandum from William J. Murray to the Inspector General, dated January 17, 1975, detailing the recruitment of Jose Raul Martinez Nunez, a Cuban national and pilot, for a clandestine operation in 1960 aimed at anti-Castro activities, including the 'possible removal of top three leaders'. The operation was ultimately called off, with assurances given to Martinez regarding his sons' education in the event of his death. Martinez later defected to the U.S. in December 1960.
key_findings: Recruitment of Jose Raul Martinez Nunez for a clandestine operation in 1960.
Consideration of 'possible removal of top three leaders' as part of anti-Castro activities.
Operation was called off after initial planning and assurances were given to Martinez.
Martinez defected to the U.S. in December 1960.
